Neuronal acetylcholine receptor subunit.Definition: A protein that is a translation product of the CHRNB4 gene or a 1:1 ortholog thereof. The neuronal acetylcholine receptor is composed of an alpha and a beta subunit. Neuronal acetylcholine receptor beta-4 subunit can be combined with alpha- 2, alpha-3 or alpha-4 to give rise to functional receptor complexes. (Adapted from UniProtKB/Swiss-Prot)
